Transcript: Speaker 0: Hello, hello, my name is Nikolay Liev, and as you may know, I cannot speak in English at the beginning of the video. If you want to learn a little bit more, then I would like to introduce you to me. Thank you very much for your time today. If you want to learn a little bit more, you can click on the like button and subscribe to my channel. Hello Peter, I have arrived here in Wiebenslau. Can you tell me a little bit more about yourself? Because I am in the RTR region, and we are the best people in the world. Then I will give you my profile. Can you tell me a little bit more about yourself? Because I am in the RTR region. Can you tell me a little bit more about yourself?
Summary: The speaker, Nikolay Liev, introduces himself and states that he cannot speak English at the beginning of the video. He invites viewers to learn more about him and thanks them for their time. He also encourages viewers to like and subscribe to his channel. He then asks Peter about himself and mentions being in the RTR region.

Transcript: Speaker 0: I have one question and that is, is there any possibility for the AI to guess what the children are going to draw?
Summary: The speaker is asking whether it is possible for AI to predict what children will draw.

Transcript: Speaker 1: hello hello. you have reached Vibha Jan Miller. I am sorry I cannot take your call. if you would like to leave a message I will get back to you as soon as possible. Speaker 2: thank you at the tone. please record your message. when you finish recording you may hang up or press 1 for more options. Speaker 0: hi Vibha I just got your resume so may I know your salary expectation yearly salary expectations so that I can just send you the RTR and you can confirm it and after that I will submit your profile. so please share your salary expectations so that I can share you the RTR. thank you and have a nice day.
Summary: Speaker 1, Vibha Jan Miller, is unable to answer the call and instructs the caller to leave a message for her to get back to them. Speaker 2 provides instructions for leaving a voicemail and Speaker 0 requests the caller's salary expectations so they can send an RTR and submit their profile.

Transcript: Speaker 0: Speaker 1: Hi, I just got a call from this number. Speaker 0: Yes. Speaker 1: May I know your good name? Speaker 0: Marion King, Mr. Paul. Speaker 1: Oh yes, I called you on your another number. I think this is another number. That is why I cannot. Speaker 0: Okay. Speaker 1: Okay. Okay. Hi, Marion. This is Shobik. I am from Arkin Staffing, basically, and I actually, you know, got your profile that is from monster.com, the job board, and I have an excellent job opportunity for you that is as a director of risk management. So, just, you know, wanted to check if you are looking for any kind of a job opportunity. Speaker 0: I actually am. I was just waiting, you know, looking for the right opportunities, there is so much out here. Oh my goodness. Yes, sir. Now, where is this located geographically? Speaker 1: So this position, it is an on-site position, and it is located in Middletown, Delaware. Speaker 0: Oh, okay. That is not, I mean, it is not next door, but it is not too far there. Speaker 1: Great. Yes. So let me tell you a little bit about the job position first. So this position, as I told you, the title is the director of risk management, and this is a full-time opportunity that one of our direct client name is Bizav International. Speaker 0: Can you say that once more? Speaker 1: It is Bizav. It is B-I-Z-A-V. Bizav. Okay. Gotcha. Okay. Speaker 0: I thought I said, well, maybe I am missing something, but I understand. Okay. Speaker 1: No problem. So this is actually an aviation and aircraft service provider company. And they want somebody who have great experience with the risk management, risk control, basically the operational risk management experience, who can make these strategies, make the models of the risk management for the firm, and who have experience or proficiency in maybe in C or C++ or MATLAB or SAS. Right? Speaker 0: Yeah. I do not want a program. I used to do that years ago. Speaker 1: It is a kind of a preferred skill, but it is not really required. But majorly, they want somebody with the risk management in the information security side and also who have experience with some of the networking part. Speaker 0: Yes. Now, I work for Comcast for years in networking and engineering. I come from networking and engineering background for like six, seven years. And then I moved over into the security and controls and GRC and a whole lot of different access management, the whole security game. And actually, I just recently, July, I obtained my CISSP. And I do not mind doing hands-on stuff, but not program. I cannot. Now, is SQL or something like that, sure, and I am also SQL certified, but going back in the, and I did quite well with, it is funny that, but that stuff drives you to drinking. Right. Speaker 1: Great. Speaker 0: Great. Yeah. That is like two different though, but that is kind of like two different jobs. doing programming and risk management is like they are asking for two different jobs in one. Speaker 1: So, here I wanted to interrupt you, sorry about that. But the, as I told you, the, this is basically a directed position. So you do not have to do the hands-on things, but, you know, this is actually a preferred, you know, experience what they are looking for. if you have in, in, in your, you know, previous background or previous companies, basically, but they are mostly focusing on the risk management part, information security and the networking side experience. These are the, yeah, yeah. So this is what we are actually looking for. And your profile, you know, looks that you have been, you know, into the risk management and compliance security and everything you have. Right. I just wanted to know, like in, in, in Monster, I can see that the last project you have done with JP Morgan and Jesus. So is this the updated resume or like after this project, you have bought anywhere? Speaker 0: No, no, no, it actually is. I just took time off to get, to go in and tackle the CISSP. I am so happy I have had first try. And then I kind of took the summer off because I was, you know, just tired. So I said, let me enjoy the summer and now I am ready to get back to work. So you know, I am back in the market now. Speaker 1: So this was your last project with JV Chases? Speaker 0: Correct. Okay. Speaker 1: All right. So, Maria, if you got selected for this role, so how soon you can be able to join? Speaker 0: Monday. Oh, okay. Speaker 1: Great. Speaker 0: Yes. Yeah. I am free right now, so I will be able to start. Speaker 1: Okay. So may I know, like, what is your expectation about the salary? Speaker 0: Well, you said it is a risk director position? Yeah. I would say probably around 150 somewhere in that area. Speaker 1: Okay. But, you know, for this role, I can give you like 140K. This is the maximum I can, you know. Speaker 0: Okay. Well, I mean, yeah, I mean, there is a lot of times some companies, they do not have as much money to distribute it as others, but the market is also, you know, currently it is not that good too. And it is kind of weird right now, I think, you know, that is why I said I was not killing myself. when the right thing comes along, it will come along. But I am like, I do not, it is just, I was just saying. And at first I thought it was me and I asked a few people, I am like, is it my resume? Like, well, they are like, no, it is the market. And they, you see all these jobs out there and they are like, they have the jobs out there, but they are not really not hiring. I am like, right, that does not, yeah, it does not make sense, but for somebody it makes, I guess that is where they are going. Speaker 1: So, right. Speaker 0: Yes. Okay. Speaker 1: That sounds really great. So I just, you know, wanted to share you the rate agreement email and I just need your acknowledgement on that. So right to represent, yes, and this is our direct line basically. And I, you know, once I have your acknowledgement, my manager, I will, I will share your profile to my manager and she will going to share your resume to the hiring manager's desk. And after that, you know, if we have anything scheduled for next week, I probably it will be, it will take one or two days to, you know, shortlist and everything. And most probably by, by the Monday they will get back to us and I will get back to you and let you know what is the feedback. Okay. Speaker 0: And please feel free to do that. Like, I do not think it is your fault. I mean, if they say, well, we want someone a little taller, we want to, you know, that is not, you know, I, I would not be mad at you when you say, Hey, did you decide to go with a different candidate? That is fine. They have that, right. It is their job. Speaker 1: Please feel free to do that. Speaker 0: You know, because I hate when you, people reach out to you and then they never get back to you. Because sometimes we keep ourself on hold. If you say next week, I was like, okay, well, I am waiting for him to get back to me. And it is only fair, you know, both ways that we, Absolutely. Speaker 1: Do not worry about that. I just, uh, you know, shared you the, uh, email to you, uh, do you have, uh, your email access right now? Speaker 0: I do. Yeah. Speaker 1: I can check. Uh, did you receive it or not? Speaker 0: Yeah, I did receive it. Yes. Mm. Speaker 1: Hmm. All right. Speaker 0: So I think, I think that, I think this one is the, okay. Now I got it. Speaker 1: Okay. Speaker 0: Right. Give me one second. I am going to recline. Speaker 1: Sure. Speaker 0: No, let me ask you this. Do they pay every week or every two weeks? Do you know? Speaker 1: Um, I exactly, I am not sure about it, but, um, I can, you know, tell my managers to ask them about it. Of course. Speaker 0: But I was just, you know, just wondering. Speaker 1: Yeah. We will let you know. Speaker 0: Oh, no problem. Okay. Speaker 1: Okay. Speaker 0: So I am almost done. Speaker 1: Mm. Hmm. Okay. Speaker 0: So you have another copy of my resume as well. Speaker 1: If, if you can, uh, attach the copy, that would be great. Okay. Yeah. Speaker 0: I will definitely do that. Give me one second. Almost done. Okay. Speaker 1: Okay. Speaker 0: Okay. Oh, for crying out loud. I apologize. Speaker 1: You have no problem. Speaker 0: I was looking in the wrong folder. Speaker 1: Okay. Speaker 0: Mm. Oh, did it attach? Mm-hmm. So we, let me see. Speaker 1: Hmm. Speaker 0: For some reason, I do not think it attached. So I am going to resend that. All right. I just sent it back to you. Okay. I guess you can give me a, you know, give me some direction whenever you get any answers from them. Absolutely. Speaker 1: Absolutely. I will definitely let you know about it. Mm-hmm. And, uh, this is your location? Yes. 600 N Broad Street. Speaker 0: Say that again. Speaker 1: 600 N Broad Street, suit five, Middletown, Delaware. Speaker 0: No, I am actually in New Jersey. I am about an hour away, but I am used to commuting to Delaware. I have worked over there before for years. Oh, actually, Jackie Morgan was in Delaware. Speaker 1: Oh, okay. Got it. Got it. Not an issue then. So I just, you know, received your, uh, uh, acknowledgement, uh, but there is no attachment in it. Speaker 0: Oh, I think you have another one with the attachment. So you will get that in a second. Speaker 1: Oh, okay. Okay. No problem. Uh, it is, uh, you know, I, I did, uh, you know, make sure that I will, uh, do my best to get the interview process. And also, you know, this company is also very good company. So you will really enjoy working with them if you got selected. So hope for the, hope for the best. And, uh, all right. All right. Speaker 0: Thank you so much. I appreciate it. Speaker 1: Thank you, Marianne. Thank you. I really enjoyed talking to you and we will talk to you soon. Speaker 0: Right. Absolutely. All right. Thank you again. Thank you. Yep. Speaker 1: Bye.
Summary: The speaker 1 is a recruiter from Arkin Staffing who contacted speaker 0, Marion King, about a job opportunity as a director of risk management at Bizav International. The job requires experience in risk management and information security, as well as proficiency in programming languages like C or C++. The salary for the position is around 140K and the job is located in Middletown, Delaware. Speaker 0 has experience in networking and engineering, as well as security and compliance. They recently obtained their CISSP certification and are currently looking for a job. The recruiter will share Speaker 0's profile with their manager and get back to them with any updates on the job opportunity. The conversation ends with the recruiter expressing their hope that Speaker 0 will get the job and enjoy working at Bizav International.

Summary: A man named Shobik from Arkin Staffing called a woman named Marion King to offer her a job opportunity as a director of risk management for a company called Bizav International. They discussed her experience and qualifications, as well as the location of the job in Middletown, Delaware. Marion expressed interest and agreed to the salary offered. Shobik sent her an email with a rate agreement and they agreed to keep in touch about the progress of her application. They ended the call on a positive note, with Shobik saying he would do his best to help her get the job.
